DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Lactate Dehydrogenase Above Upper Limit of Normal Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting within a family of homotetrameric cytoplasmic enzymes involved in the conversion of L-lactate and NAD to pyruvate and NADH in the final step of anaerobic glycolysis. In vertebrates, genes for three different subunits (LDH-A, LDH-B and LDH-C) exist. The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

In vertebrates, genes for three different subunits (LDH-A, LDH-B and LDH-C) exist. The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
